titles.title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to modify the appointment and grade of the Chief of the Army Medical Specialist Corps.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary:
4/12/2011--Introduced. Requires that an appointee to the position of Chief of the Army Medical Specialist Corps be of a rank not less than lieutenant colonel. (Current minimum rank is captain.)
Requires an appointee to such position holding a lower grade to be appointed in the regular grade of brigadier general.
